# How to format an article for the *AKES Newsletter*

*by Matt Bowser^[USFWS Kenai National Wildlife Refuge, Soldotna, Alaska, <matt_bowser@fws.gov>]*

## Background

The first issue of the *Newsletter of the Alaska Entomological Society* (2006) was written in Microsoft^Â®^ Word. To improve the appearance and uniformity of the *Newsletter*, from 2008 to 2021 it was written in LaTeX^[<https://www.latex-project.org/>], borrowing most of its styling from the journal *R News*^[<https://cran.r-project.org/doc/Rnews/>]. In order to make formatting articles easier and in order to increase accessibility by adding an HTML output option, a version of the *Newsletter* was created in RStudio using R Markdown. Source code from 2020 to 2023 issues of the *AKES Newsletter* are available from a GitHub repository^[<https://github.com/Alaska-Entomological-Society/AKES_Newsletter>].

This article describes the way articles should be prepared and provides examples of typical figures, a table, etc.

## Writing articles

To get started, download the example article release from GitHub, which includes 

- `year/issue/example_article.Rmd`, the R Markdown source of this example article;
- `year/issue/example_article.bib`, the bibliographic data for this article in  BibTeX format; 
- `year/issue/AKES_newsletter_year_issue.Rmd`, an example *AKES Newsletter* issue; and 
- `share/*`, shared files used for document setup and styling.

The `example_article.Rmd` R Markdown file can then be renamed as appropriate and edited in a text editor or in an integrated development environment like RStudio.  See @Xieetal2023 for a guide to using R Markdown. See examples of previous articles from the 2022 and 2023 issues of the *Newsletter*. Source R Markdown files from all submitted articles are available from the GitHub repository. 

## Rendering

Individual articles can be opened in RStudio and rendered to formatted HTML output pressing the "Knit"  button. Compilation of individual articles should suffice for testing readiness for submission to the editors of the *Newsletter*.

To render the complete issue as a pdf,

1. open the example *AKES Newsletter* issue R Markdown file in Rstudio,
2. edit the lines in the YAML header below `section-refs-bibliography:`, adding all of the bibliography files,
3. edit the `articles <- c("example_article.Rmd")` line so that all articles are included, and
4. press the "Knit" button in RStudio.

Compilation of the pdf version of the *Newsletter* requires many LaTeX packages as dependencies, so you will likely need to install many packages the first time you try to compile the *Newsletter*.
